<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">83</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='83',FILE='C:\fc\356134810466_D11085_721388\21932-1-du.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Dec 22 13:49 2005' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Consulting
Arrangement with Aurelius Consulting Group,&nbsp;Inc.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to a marketing
agreement, dated September&nbsp;2, 2003, with Aurelius Consulting Group,&nbsp;Inc.,
as part of the compensation for the services to be provided by Aurelius under
the agreement, which had an initial term of 12&nbsp;months, the Company agreed
to issue to Aurelius 45,000 shares of Common Stock per quarter, payable at the
midpoint of each quarter, subject to renegotiation after the first six months. &#160;As of September&nbsp;30, 2004, the agreement
was renegotiated and the Company issued 90,000 shares of common stock to
Aurelius. The Company has expensed approximately $192,000 during fiscal year
2004.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="P_PreferredStock_104743"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">P. PREFERRED STOCK</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is authorized
to issue up to 1,000,000 shares of Preferred Stock, $0.01 par value per share.
The Preferred Stock may be issued in one or more series, the terms of which may
be determined at the time of issuance by the Board of Directors, without
further action by stockholders, and may include voting rights (including the
right to vote as a series on particular matters), preferences as to dividends
and liquidation, conversion and redemption rights and sinking fund provisions. See
Note&nbsp;J for a discussion of redeemable convertible Series&nbsp;A Preferred
Stock issued in February&nbsp;2003 and Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock issued in October&nbsp;2003.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="Q_SignificantCustomers_104743"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Q. SIGNIFICANT CUSTOMERS</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30, 2005,
2004 and 2003, there was one significant customer, defined as those customers
that account for 10% or more of total net revenue in a fiscal year or 10% or
more of accounts receivable and unbilled contract costs and fees at the end of
a fiscal year. At September&nbsp;30, 2005, approximately 15% of the Company&#146;s
gross receivables were due from one customer. As of December&nbsp;15, 2005 the
customer had made payments related to these outstanding amounts of
approximately $524,000. At December&nbsp;15, 2005, approximately $550,000 of
the balance due at September&nbsp;30, 2005 remained outstanding.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, management
estimates that approximately 40%, 50% and 50% of the revenue during fiscal
years 2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively, was derived from government contracts
and subcontracts with the U.S. government&#146;s prime contractors.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">84</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest and Income
Taxes Paid</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash
paid for interest and income taxes was as follows:</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="45" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">386,652</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="301" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:225.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Income taxes</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="45" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">85</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='85',FILE='C:\fc\350162933241_P83101_710910\21932-1-dw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Dec 16 16:31 2005' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="S_Acquisitions_104744"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">S. ACQUISITIONS</font></b></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sipex Corporation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On September&nbsp;27,
2002, the Company purchased certain intellectual property, equipment and other
assets from Sipex Corporation. These assets were used by Sipex in connection
with its thin film and hybrid assembly business. In consideration for these
foregoing asset, Sipex was entitled to receive royalty payments up to $183,500
based on cash receipts from existing backlog and between $400,000 and
$1,050,000 from cash receipts from new business of Sipex products by the
Company for the subsequent three years. The purchase price was determined based
on the sum of (1)&nbsp;the present value of the minimum payments required under
the purchase and sale agreement of $309,608 and (2)&nbsp;the royalty payments
related to the backlog as of September&nbsp;27, 2002 of $107,139. The Company
has recorded these amounts as a liability and will accrete them by charging
interest expense until paid. The Company will charge, to the extent of the
liability established for that year, contingent payments against the liability.
Payments in excess of that year&#146;s liability will be charged as a royalty
expense in the statement of operations. The purchase price of the asset
purchase has been allocated as follows:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="430" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:322.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Inventory</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>

  equipment</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The pro forma financial information has not been
presented, as this transaction is the purchase of assets rather than a business
combination.</font></p>

following is a rollforward of the minimum payment required under the purchase
and sale agreement:</font></p>

fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004, the Company recorded $0
and $12,518, respectively, of royalty expense in connection with this
agreement.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="T_LossPerShare_104745"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">T. LOSS PER SHARE</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following is the reconciliation of the numerators and denominators of the basic
and diluted loss per share computations:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of
the fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, 2004 and 2003, shares of Common
Stock issuable upon the exercise of options and warrants were excluded from the
diluted average common shares outstanding, as their effect would have been
antidilutive. In addition, shares of Common Stock issuable upon the conversion
of redeemable convertible Preferred Stock were excluded from the diluted
weighted average common shares outstanding as their effect would also have been
dilutive. &#160;The table below summarizes the
option and warrants and convertible Preferred Stock that were excluded from the
calculation above due to their effect being antidilutive:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr>
  <td width="390" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:292.65pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="198" colspan="5" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:148.5pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">September&nbsp;30,</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;19, 2004,
the Company completed the first phase of its stock option exchange offer. A
total of 781,158 options with an average exercise price of approximately $12.30
were tendered by employees and directors and then cancelled by the Company in
exchange for the future issuance of options. New options were to be issued in
the final phase of the exchange offer on or after October&nbsp;20, 2004 at the then
current market price to employees and directors who were employed by the
Company or served as directors of the Company from the acceptance date through
the date that the new options were granted. The Company was obligated to issue
684,008 options associated with the exchange, subject to certain conditions. Executive
officers of the Company elected not to participate in the program. Ultimately,
in October&nbsp;2004, the Company issued 658,508 options with an exercise price
of $2.08 per share. (See Note <font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">O.<b><font style="font-weight:bold;"> </font></b>Stockholders Equity)</font></font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">87</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='87',FILE='C:\fc\350162933241_P83101_710910\21932-1-dw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Dec 16 16:31 2005' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="U_SegmentDisclosures_104745"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">U. SEGMENT DISCLOSURES</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s organizational structure is based on
strategic business units that perform services and offer various products to
the principal markets in which the Company&#146;s products are sold. These business
units equate to three reportable segments: Applied Technology, Power Systems
and Electronics.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SatCon Applied Technology,&nbsp;Inc. performs research
and development services in collaboration with third parties. SatCon Power
Systems,&nbsp;Inc. specializes in the engineering and manufacturing of power
systems. SatCon Electronics,&nbsp;Inc. designs and manufactures electronic
products. The Company&#146;s principal operations and markets are located in the
United States.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The accounting policies of each of the segments are
the same as those described in the summary of significant accounting policies.
The Company evaluates performance based on revenue and profit and loss from
operations, including amortization of intangibles. Common costs not directly
attributable to a particular segment are included in the Applied Technology
segment. These costs include corporate costs such as executive officer
compensation, facility costs, legal, audit and tax and other professional fees
and totaled 2,862,849, $2,445,507 and $4,574,291 for the fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30,
2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">88</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='88',FILE='C:\fc\350162933241_P83101_710910\21932-1-dw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Dec 16 16:31 2005' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following is a summary of the Company&#146;s operations by operating segment:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">89</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='89',FILE='C:\fc\350162933241_P83101_710910\21932-1-dw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Dec 16 16:31 2005' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Common
assets not directly attributable to a particular segment are included in the
Applied Technology segment. These assets include cash and cash equivalents,
prepaid and other corporate assets which amounted to $7,177,184 and $2,924,667
at September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004, respectively. The following is a summary
of the Company&#146;s assets by operating segment:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr>
  <td width="328" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:245.8pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company operates and markets its services and products on a worldwide basis
with its principal markets as follows:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr>
  <td width="244" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:182.7pt;">

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8,941,166</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="344" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:258.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Rest of world</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  and intangible assets)</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9,008,766</font></p>

  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="V_RestructuringCosts_104747"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">V. RESTRUCTURING COSTS</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During April&nbsp;2002, the Company commenced a
restructuring plan designed to streamline its production base, improve
efficiency and enhance its competitiveness and recorded a restructuring charge
of $1.5&nbsp;million. The restructuring charge included approximately $655,000
for severance costs associated with the reduction of approximately 60
employees. As of September&nbsp;30, 2004, all 60 employees had been terminated
and $565,647 of the severance had been paid. The balance of the restructuring
charge relates to the closing of the Anaheim, CA facility. These costs include
approximately $270,000 of cash charges primarily related to rent, real estate
taxes and operating costs to be paid from October&nbsp;1, 2002 through
June&nbsp;30, 2003, the remainder of the lease, and an estimated $350,000 of
other cash charges for restoration and clean-up. As of September&nbsp;30, 2004,
the Company had paid $270,000 of charges primarily related to rent, real estate
taxes and operating. As of September&nbsp;30, 2004, $43,680 had been paid
against the $350,000 of other cash charges for restoration and clean-up. In
addition, approximately $225,000 of the restructuring </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">90</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='90',FILE='C:\fc\350162933241_P83101_710910\21932-1-dw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Dec 16 16:31 2005' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">charge related to non-cash
charges on assets to be disposed of. As of September&nbsp;30, 2004, $125,061
net book value of assets have been identified and written off against this
amount. As of September&nbsp;30, 2004, the Company had $495,612 accrued related
to a restructuring cost. On January&nbsp;27, 2005, the Company reached a
settlement with the landlord of the Anaheim facility in the amount of $240,000
as final settlement for all claims. In addition, the Company has determined
that all remaining restructuring liabilities accrued are no longer warranted
and that all matters related to the restructuring charge have been settled,
therefore the Company has adjusted all remaining balances related to severance
costs, facilities cost and equipment costs remaining, resulting in a reduction
of accrued restructuring charges of $255,612 and reflected in the Company&#146;s
statement of operations for the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2005. The
Company paid the remaining balance of $240,000 during the quarter ended
April&nbsp;2, 2005. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following is a status of the Company&#146;s accrued restructuring costs and the
changes for the periods then ended:</font></p>

<div align="center">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="W_ProductWarranties_104747"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">W. PRODUCT WARRANTIES</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In its Power Systems Division the Company provides a
warranty to its customers for most of its products sold. In general the Company&#146;s
warranties are for one year after the sale of the product, and in some limited
instances two years. The Company reviews its warranty liability quarterly. Factors
taken into consideration when evaluating the Company&#146;s warranty reserve are (i)&nbsp;historical
claims for each product, (ii)&nbsp;the development stage of the product, and (iii)&nbsp;other
factors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following is a summary of the Company&#146;s accrued warranty activity for the
following periods:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr>
  <td width="348" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:261.2pt;">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="X_SubsequentEvents_104748"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">X. SUBSEQUENT EVENTS</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On November&nbsp;21, 2005, the Company entered into a
Second Loan Modification and Security Agreement (the &#147;Second Loan Modification
Agreement&#148;) with Silicon Valley Bank (the &#147;Bank&#148;). The Second Loan Modification
Agreement modifies the Loan and Security Agreement, dated as of January&nbsp;31,
2005, between the parties, as previously amended by the Loan Modification
Agreement, dated as of May&nbsp;31, 2005 as amended, (the &#147;Loan Agreement&#148;). Under
the Second Loan Modification Agreement, the Bank modified the terms related to
the collection of receivables for amounts outstanding under the Loan Agreement,
as well as the minimum tangible net worth covenant, as defined, which the
Company must maintain in order to continue to borrow from the Bank. The Bank
also provided waivers for the Company&#146;s failure to comply with the minimum
tangible net worth requirements as of August&nbsp;6, 2005 and September&nbsp;30,
2005. In addition, the Second Loan Modification Agreement provides the ability
to borrow </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">91</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='91',FILE='C:\fc\350162933241_P83101_710910\21932-1-dw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Dec 16 16:31 2005' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">up to $3,000,000 on a
revolver basis paying only interest provided that the Company remains in
compliance with all financial covenants, as defined. The Loan Agreement, as
amended, will expire on January&nbsp;30, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;13, 2005, the Company sold its shaker
and amplifier product lines, the associated inventory and intellectual property
to Qualmark,&nbsp;Inc., for proceeds of approximately $2.3 million. The Company
will account for the sale of these assets in its first fiscal quarter of 2006.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">92</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='92',FILE='C:\fc\350162933241_P83101_710910\21932-1-dw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Dec 16 16:31 2005' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="ReportOfIndependentRegisteredPubl_113806"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">REPORT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED&#160; PUBLIC ACCOUNTING&#160; FIRM ON<br>
SUPPLEMENTARY SCHEDULE</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To the Board of Directors of SatCon Technology
Corporation:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 24.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have audited, in
accordance with the Standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board
(United States), the consolidated financial statements of SatCon Technology
Corporation and its subsidiaries as of September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004 and the
consolidated results of their operations and their cash flows for each of the
three years in the period ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, included in this Form&nbsp;10-K,
and have issued our report thereon dated December&nbsp;15, 2005. Our audits
were made for the purpose of forming an opinion on those consolidated financial
statements taken as a whole. The schedule listed in the financial statement
schedule index is the responsibility of the Company&#146;s management and is
presented for purposes of complying with the Securities and Exchange Commission&#146;s
rules&nbsp;and is not a part of the basic consolidated financial statements.
This schedule for the fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, 2004 and 2003
has been subjected to auditing procedures applied in the audits of the basic
consolidated financial statements and, in our opinion, fairly states, in all
material respects, the financial data required to be set forth therein in
relation to the basic consolidated financial statements taken as a whole.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 228.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">/s/ <font style="text-transform:uppercase;">Grant Thornton</font> LLP</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 390.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Boston, Massachusetts<br>
December&nbsp;15, 2005</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">93</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  at&nbsp;end<br>
  of&nbsp;period</font></b></p>

  </td>
  <td width="62" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:46.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">495,612</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="55" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:41.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(255,612</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="22" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.4pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="22" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.4pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">94</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='94',FILE='C:\fc\356154821175_P83101_721735\21932-1-fa.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Dec 22 15:49 2005' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><a name="Item9_ChangesInAndDisagreementsWi_115733"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item
9.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>CHANGES IN
AND DISAGREEMENTS WITH ACCOUNTANTS ON ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL DISCLOSURE</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 8.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Not applicable.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><a name="Item9a_ControlsAndProceduresopen_161920"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item
9A.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>CONTROLS AND
PROCEDURES</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As required by
Rule&nbsp;13a-15 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as of the end of
the period covered by this report, we carried out an evaluation under the
supervision and with the participation of our management, including our Chief
Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, of the effectiveness of our
disclosure controls and procedures. While we have identified certain internal
control deficiencies, which are discussed below, our evaluation indicated that
these deficiencies did not impair the effectiveness of our overall disclosure
controls and procedures.&#160; Based upon that
evaluation, the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer concluded
that our disclosure controls and procedures are effective to ensure that
information required to be disclosed by us in the reports we file or submit
under the Exchange Act is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within
the time periods specified in the Securities and Exchange Commission's rules
and forms. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our management and Audit
Committee were notified by Grant Thornton LLP (&#147;Grant Thornton&#148;) of four
significant deficiencies in our internal control over financial reporting that they
observed during the audit of the September 30, 2005 financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The first significant
deficiency relates to a need to formalize policies and procedures (including a
comprehensive accounting and financial reporting policies and procedures manual,
a policy that requires an annual vacation for all employees and periodic
rotation of duties, and policies and procedures relating to information
technology).&#160; We had begun to formalize
policies in this area prior to receiving Grant Thornton&#146;s observations and will
continue with these plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The second significant
deficiency relates to financial reporting and income tax disclosures.&#160;&#160; With respect to financial reporting
disclosures, Grant Thornton noted that an early draft of our Form 10-K required
corrections as a result of our internal control procedures not being performed
on a timely basis.&#160; With respect to
income tax disclosures, Grant Thornton noted that we need to enhance the technical
knowledge of personnel preparing and reviewing the income tax disclosures or
consider outsourcing this function.&#160; We
plan to outsource the income tax function in fiscal 2006.&#160; In addition, we have adopted procedures
designed to enhance our review of our financial reporting disclosures, which
procedures will be implemented in fiscal year 2006. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The third significant
deficiency relates to the need for monitoring controls to ensure that
operational controls are operating as designed (including periodic observation
and re-performance of operational controls).&#160;
We continue to develop and implement these monitoring controls and will
continue to evaluate their effectiveness during fiscal year 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The fourth significant
deficiency relates to an instance of a control failure around evaluation of
proper revenue recognition.&#160; We plan to
design and implement enhanced review procedures during fiscal year 2006.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(b)</font><font style="font-style:italic;"><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; Changes in Internal Control Over
Financial Reporting. </i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There was no change in our
internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the fourth
fiscal quarter that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to
materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 8.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal 2005,
however, we implemented and improved our segregation of duties (particularly
for certain cash receipts and maintaining segregation of duties), an area which
was noted as a significant deficiency by Grant Thornton during the audit of our
fiscal 2004 financial statements.&#160; We
will continue to evaluate the effectiveness of these changes and implement
improvements as we see fit.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><a name="Item9b_OtherInformation__161958"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 9B.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>OTHER
INFORMATION.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Not applicable</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:12.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">95</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="Partiii_162133"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART&nbsp;III</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><a name="Item10_DirectorsAndExecutiveOffic_162134"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 10.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>DIRECTORS
AND EXECUTIVE OFFICERS OF THE REGISTRANT</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The information with
respect to directors and executive officers required under this item is
incorporated herein by reference to the information set forth under the
sections entitled &#147;Election of Directors&#148; and &#147;Executive Officers of the
Corporation&#148; in our proxy statement for our 2006 Annual Meeting of
Stockholders. Information relating to certain filings on Forms 3, 4 and 5 is
contained in our 2006 proxy statement under the caption &#147;Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;Beneficial
Ownership Reporting Compliance.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><a name="Item11_ExecutiveCompensation_162136"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 11.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>EXECUTIVE
COMPENSATION</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The information required under this item is
incorporated herein by reference to the section entitled &#147;Compensation of
Executive Officers&#148; in our 2006 proxy statement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The sections entitled &#147;Compensation
Committee Report on Executive Compensation&#148; and &#147;Comparative Stock Performance
Graph&#148; in our 2006 proxy statement are not incorporated herein by reference.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><a name="Item12_SecurityOwnershipOfCertain_162139"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 12.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>SECURITY
OWNERSHIP OF CERTAIN BENEFICIAL OWNERS AND MANAGEMENT AND RELATED STOCKHOLDER
MATTERS</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The information required
under this item is incorporated herein by reference to the sections entitled &#147;Security
Ownership of Certain Beneficial Owners and Management&#148; and &#147;Securities
Authorized for Issuance Under Equity Compensation Plans&#148; in our 2006 proxy
statement.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><a name="Item13_CertainRelationshipsAndRel_162141"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 13.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>CERTAIN
RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The information required
under this item is incorporated herein by reference to the section entitled &#147;Certain
Relationships and Related Party Transactions&#148; in our 2006 proxy statement.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><a name="Item14_PrincipalAccountingFeesAnd_162144"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 14.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>PRINCIPAL
ACCOUNTING FEES AND SERVICES</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The information required
under this item is incorporated herein by reference to the section entitled &#147;Independent
Auditor Fees and Other Matters&#148; in our 2006 proxy statement.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="Partiv_162146"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART&nbsp;IV</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><a name="Item15_ExhibitsFinancialStatement_162147"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 15.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>EXHIBITS,
FINANCIAL STATEMENT SCHEDULES</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following
documents are filed as part of this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Consolidated Financial Statements of SatCon Technology Corporation and
its Subsidiaries:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Consolidated Balance
Sheets as of September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Consolidated Statements
of Operations for the Fiscal Years Ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, 2004 and 2003</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Consolidated Statements
of Changes in Stockholders&#146; Equity and Comprehensive Loss for the Fiscal Years
Ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, 2004 and 2003</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Consolidated
Statements of Cash Flows for the Fiscal Years Ended September&nbsp;30, 2005,
2004 and 2003</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to
Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Financial Statement Schedule of SatCon
Technology Corporation and its Subsidiaries:</font></i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Schedule&nbsp;II: Valuation and Qualifying Accounts
for the Fiscal Years Ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, 2004 and 2003</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All other financial statement schedules not listed
have been omitted because they are either not required, not applicable, or the
information has been included elsewhere in the consolidated financial
statements or notes thereto.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Exhibits:</font></i></font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="321" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:240.7pt;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">David B.
  Eisenhaure</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="259" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:194.4pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="29" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="321" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:240.7pt;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">President,
  Chief Executive Officer<br>
  and Chairman of the Board</font></i></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant
to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, this report has
been signed by the following persons in the capacities and on the dates
indicated.</font></p>

  by reference to Exhibits to the Registrant&#146;s Quarterly Report on Form&nbsp;10-Q
  for the period ended June&nbsp;30, 1999 (File&nbsp;No.&nbsp;1-11512).</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;10.72</font></p>

  Warrant to purchase shares of Common Stock of the Registrant issued on
  December&nbsp;22, 2004 is incorporated herein by reference to Exhibits to the

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><a name="ConsentOfIndependentRegisteredPub_125450"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">EXHIBIT
23.1</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="ConsentOfIndependentRegisteredPub_130617"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING
FIRM</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
have issued our reports, dated December&nbsp;15, 2005, accompanying the
consolidated financial statements and schedule included in the Annual Report of
SatCon Technology Corporation on Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended September&nbsp;30,
2005. We hereby consent to the incorporation by reference of said reports in
the Registration Statements of SatCon Technology Corporation on Form&nbsp;S-8
(File Nos. 033-75934, 333-04280, 333-08047, 333-75339,
333-43802, 333-67504, 333-100753, 333-125882 and 333-125883)
and Form&nbsp;S-3 (File&nbsp;Nos.&nbsp;333-05939, 333-37921,
333-87157, 333-94859, 333-48936, 333-67328, 333-103950,
333-111522, 333-116533 and 333-128527).</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr>
  <td width="304" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:228.0pt;">

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="304" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:228.0pt;">
  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:12.0pt 0pt .0001pt;">Boston, Massachusetts<br>
  December&nbsp;15, 2005</p>
  </td>
  <td width="304" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:228.05pt;">

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-31.1
<SEQUENCE>4
<FILENAME>a05-21932_1ex31d1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>302 CERTIFICATION
<TEXT>
<html>

<head>






</head>

<body lang="EN-US">

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><a name="CertificationPursuantToSection302_125212"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">EXHIBIT 31.1</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="CertificationPursuantToSection302_125751"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certification Pursuant to<br>
Section&nbsp;302 of the<br>
Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I, David B.
Eisenhaure, certify that:</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>I have reviewed
this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of SatCon Technology Corporation;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Based on my
knowledge, this annual report does not contain any untrue statement of a
material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements
made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not
misleading with respect to the period covered by this annual report;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Based on my
knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included
in this annual report, fairly present in all material respects the financial
condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and
for, the periods presented in this annual report;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The registrant&#146;s
other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining
disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e)&nbsp;and
15d-15(e)) for the registrant and have:</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>designed such
disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and
procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material
information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries,
is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the
period in which this annual report is being prepared;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">b)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>evaluated the
effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures, and
presented in this annual report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the
disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this
report based on such evaluation; and</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">c)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>disclosed in this annual report any
change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that
occurred during the registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter that has materially
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s
internal control over financial reporting; and</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The registrant&#146;s
other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent
evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s
auditors and the audit committee of registrant&#146;s board of directors (or persons
performing the equivalent functions):</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>all significant
deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal
control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely
affect the registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report
financial information; and</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 18.0pt 60.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">b)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who
have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting.</p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr>
  <td width="365" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:273.5pt;">

<body lang="EN-US">

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><a name="CertificationPursuantTo_131055"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">EXHIBIT 31.2</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="CertificationPursuantToSection302_131136"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certification Pursuant to<br>
Section&nbsp;302 of the<br>
Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I, Davie E. O&#146;Neil,
certify that:</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>I have reviewed
this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of SatCon Technology Corporation;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Based on my
knowledge, this annual report does not contain any untrue statement of a
material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements
made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not
misleading with respect to the period covered by this annual report;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Based on my
knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included
in this annual report, fairly present in all material respects the financial
condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for,
the periods presented in this annual report;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The registrant&#146;s
other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining
disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e)&nbsp;and
15d-15(e)) for the registrant and have:</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>designed such
disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and
procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material
information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries,
is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the
period in which this annual report is being prepared;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">b)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>evaluated the
effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures, and
presented in this annual report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the
disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this
report based on such evaluation; and</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">c)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>disclosed in this annual report any
change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that
occurred during the registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter that has materially
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s
internal control over financial reporting; and</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The registrant&#146;s
other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent
evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s
auditors and the audit committee of registrant&#146;s board of directors (or persons
performing the equivalent functions):</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 60.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>all significant
deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal
control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely
affect the registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report
financial information; and</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 18.0pt 60.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">b)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who
have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting.</p>

<TYPE>EX-32.1

<DESCRIPTION>906 CERTIFICATION

<html>

<head>






</head>

<body lang="EN-US">

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><a name="CertificationPursuantTo_131914"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">EXHIBIT 32.1</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="CertificationPursuantTo18U_s_c_Se_131956"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certification Pursuant to<br>
18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350,<br>
as Adopted Pursuant to<br>
Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In connection with
the Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K of SatCon Technology Corporation (the
&#147;Company&#148;) for the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 as filed with the
Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the &#147;Report&#148;), each of
the undersigned officers of the Company hereby certifies, pursuant to 18 U.S.C.
Section&nbsp;1350, that:</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The Report fully complies
with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a)&nbsp;or 15(d), as applicable, of
the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;); and</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The information contained
in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial
condition and results of operations of the Company.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">This
certification is being furnished as an exhibit to the Report pursuant to 18
U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the
Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, and shall not be deemed &#147;filed&#148; for purposes of Section&nbsp;18
of the Exchange Act, or otherwise subject to the liability of that section. This
certification will not be deemed to be incorporated by reference into any
filing under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Exchange Act,
regardless of any general incorporation language in such filing, except to the
extent that the Company specifically incorporates this certification by
reference.</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">

  </td>

  <td width="351" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:263.05pt;">

  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="242" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:181.2pt;">

  </td>
 </tr>
